bibliographic-data.invention-title: FEEDBACK BASED MODEL VALIDATION AND SERVICE DELIVERY OPTIMIZATION USING MULTIPLE MODELS

nplcit.text: Koole, Ger. Optimization of Business Processes: An Introduction to Applied Stochastic Modeling. VU University Amsterdam. 2010

abstract.p: An approach for validating a model is presented. Data from a system being modeled is collected. First and second models of the system are constructed from the collected data. Based on the first model, a first determination of an aspect of the system is determined. Based on the second model, a second determination of the aspect of the system is determined. A variation between the first and second determinations is determined. An input for resolving the variation is received and in response, a model of the system that reduces the variation is derived.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: FEEDBACK BASED MODEL VALIDATION AND SERVICE DELIVERY OPTIMIZATION USING MULTIPLE MODELS
VALIDATION DE MODÈLE ET OPTIMISATION DE DISTRIBUTION DE SERVICE BASÉES SUR UNE RÉTROACTION À L'AIDE DE MULTIPLES MODÈLES

nplcit.text: HOUSTON.: 'Elements of a generalized duration forecasting model of test-and-fix cycles' INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON SOFTWARE AND SYSTEM PROCESS (ICSSP) June 2012, pages 93 - 100, XP032195585
DIAO ET AL.: 'Staffing optimization in complex service delivery systems' THE 7TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ONNETWORK AND SERVICE MANAGEMENT (CNSM) October 2011, pages 1 - 9., XP032073586

abstract.p: An approach for validating a model is presented. Data from a system being modeled is collected. First and second models of the system are constructed from the collected data. Based on the first model, a first determination of an aspect of the system is determined. Based on the second model, a second determination of the aspect of the system is determined. A variation between the first and second determinations is determined. An input for resolving the variation is received and in response, a model of the system that reduces the variation is derived.

L'invention concerne une approche pour valider un modèle. Des données provenant d'un système qui est modélisé sont collectées. Des premier et second modèles du système sont construits à partir des données collectées. Sur la base du premier modèle, une première détermination d'un aspect du système est déterminée. Sur la base du second modèle, une seconde détermination de l'aspect du système est déterminée. Une variation entre les première et seconde déterminations est déterminée. Une entrée pour résoudre la variation est reçue et, en réponse, un modèle du système qui réduit la variation est obtenu.
